definition: to shout/to call/to order/to ask/to be called/by (indicates agent in the passive mood)

sentences.english: The scout with shoulder-straps shouted on the outermost route as a routine.
sentences.chinese: 戴肩章的侦查员按例在最核心的线路上叫嚷。

sentences.english: The whole army begins to clamour for the fos se to be filled up.
sentences.chinese: 全军都开始叫嚷着要将壕堑填平。

sentences.english: The officer bellowed (out) a command to his men.
sentences.chinese: 军官叫嚷着对士兵下命令。

sentences.english: The whole army began to clamour for the fosse to be filled up.
sentences.chinese: 全军都开始叫嚷著要将壕堑填平。

sentences.english: The whole army began to clamour for the fosse to be filled up.
sentences.chinese: 全军都开始叫嚷着要将壕堑填平。

sentences.english: The captain bellowed a command at the troops.
sentences.chinese: 上尉叫嚷着向士兵下命令。

sentences.english: The old man rant that nobody pay any attention to his opinion.
sentences.chinese: 老人怒气冲冲地叫嚷说没人听他的意见。

sentences.english: But he flashes an infectious smile as he greets a minivan full of visitors, and it’s not only kids clamoring for a chance to glide through the air.
sentences.chinese: 只听孩子和大人都在为试玩空中单车叫嚷着。

sentences.english: People gathered outside the gates, yammering for the appearance of the minister.
sentences.chinese: 人们聚集在门外，叫嚷着部长出来见。

sentences.english: A feeble cry came from the next room.
sentences.chinese: 从隔邻房间里传来低弱的叫嚷声。

sentences.english: He wobbles up to the bar and hollers for a drink.
sentences.chinese: 他摇晃着，大声地叫嚷着要来一杯。

sentences.english: S. islimited to making a few mewing noises for show and Congress is silent.
sentences.chinese: 美国仅限于叫嚷几声，国会是沉默的。

sentences.english: Suddenly I heard it-the clanging noise of pounding and kicking and yelling at the door of my heart!
sentences.chinese: 突然，我听到了重击，踢蹋，叫嚷心之门的声音。

sentences.english: “If you’d just let me say it!” he yelps occasionally, to which she always responds, “Yes, dear.”
sentences.chinese: 他叫嚷着，她总是回答，“当然，亲爱的。”

sentences.english: They shout loudly and harshly to each other, and kick and leap and catch with arrogant grace.
sentences.chinese: 他们大声又刺耳地向对方叫嚷，又踢又跳，傲慢无礼。

definition: to shout and quarrel/to make a big fuss
to argue noisily/to shout/to make widely known/to reproach
to berate/to excoriate/to chide/also written 呵斥[he1 chi4]
to berate/to excoriate/to chide/also written 喝斥[he1 chi4]
shouting and screaming (idiom); to scream loudly/to rant/to kick up a racket/to conduct vigorous propaganda
